thread.title: Critics Lament Tillerson’s Decision To Skip Brussels NATO Conference
thread.title_full: Critics Lament Tillerson’s Decision To Skip Brussels NATO Conference

author: Fred Maxwell
title: Critics Lament Tillerson’s Decision To Skip Brussels NATO Conference
text:
The State Department defended the decision , saying Tillerson will meet with foreign ministers of 26 of the other 27 NATO countries — all but Croatia — on Wednesday during a conference in Washington to discuss steps to defeat ISIS. 
He has previously talked with many of them at a meeting in Germany last month. 
U.S. officials say that Tillerson is skipping the Brussels meeting in order to attend the talks between President Donald Trump and China’s President Xi Jinping, scheduled for April 5-6 at Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida.   
Critics have decried Tillerson’s decision to miss the first full NATO foreign ministers’ meeting since his confirmation as secretary of state. 
New York Rep. Eliot Engel, the senior Democrat on the House Foreign Affairs Committee, called the move a mistake: 
“Donald Trump’s administration is making a grave error that will shake the confidence of America’s most important alliance and feed the concern that this administration is simply too cozy with [Russian President] Vladimir Putin.” 
“I cannot fathom why the administration would pursue this course except to signal a change in American foreign policy that draws our country away from Western democracy’s most important institutions and aligns the United States more closely with the autocratic regime in the Kremlin,” Engel said.
